item.title: Several questions about Forms
item.dc:creator: @Ron Ron
item.description:
@Ron wrote:

[quote=“cruel, post:6, topic:28020”]^No.
But he could simply create a TLabel array like that on TForm load.
Components[] property you might be able to use too. It’s an array of all child components. I know the TForm object of SCAR has it, but I’m not sure how limited it is compared to Delphi. You can use the ComponentCount property to loop through all of 'em.[/quote]

Cruel how would I make the labels into an array? It would really help and would clean up the code a lot!

Read full topic

item.title: Several questions about Forms
item.dc:creator: @cruel cruel
item.description:
@cruel wrote:

^No.
But he could simply create a TLabel array like that on TForm load.
Components[] property you might be able to use too. It’s an array of all child components. I know the TForm object of SCAR has it, but I’m not sure how limited it is compared to Delphi. You can use the ComponentCount property to loop through all of 'em.

Read full topic

item.title: Several questions about Forms
item.dc:creator: @N4TH4N N4TH4N
item.description:
@N4TH4N wrote:

This kind of goes with one of your questions, is it possible to set arrays of form components in Delphi/SCAR? Like…
Label[0]
Label[1]
?

If so you can be like:
[scar]
blah:= 0;
for i:=25 to 35 do
Label[i]:= Abcd[blah];
blah:= blah + 1;
end;
[/scar]

Read full topic

item.title: Several questions about Forms
item.dc:creator: @The_Un-Named The Un-Named
item.description:
@The_Un-Named wrote:

Hmm.

  1. Yes, if your edit box is called Edit1, then use Edit1.MaxLength := 10; (I BELIEVE, NOT 100%).

  2. Yes, if your edit box is called Edit1, then use Edit1.Align;

  3. Are you sure you set every procedure using vars in the mainline? Explain a bit more.

  4. I’m not sure. I have a lot of trouble with arrays and loops. (Array[var] ect)

  5. Try using the OnClick command? Ect: Button1.OnClick @Procedure;

  6. Yes, keep Visibility to true and scar the client always on top, but don’t call “Set.Visibility := True;” like it says in the f1 help file. If it’s true it doesn’t need to be set to true again.

Read full topic

item.title: Several questions about Forms
item.dc:creator: @Ron Ron
item.description:
@Ron wrote:

Here there are, if you can answer, thanks a lot!

If you answer yes to any of these, what command do I use to do the following?

  1. Is there a way to set a max length for Input Boxes?
  2. Is there a way to align the text in an Input Box?
  3. When I set a button to call a procedure which saves text to an array and back in the button procedure I try to call one of the array’s information, and yet, it’s not in there. In fact, the whole array is blank. Why is that?
  4. Is there any way to optimize these commands into a loop?
    Label25.Caption := Abcd[0];
    Label26.Caption := Abcd[1];
    Label27.Caption := Abcd[2];
    Label28.Caption := Abcd[3];
    Label29.Caption := Abcd[4];
    Label30.Caption := Abcd[5];
    Label31.Caption := Abcd[6];
    Label32.Caption := Abcd[7];
    Label33.Caption := Abcd[8];
    Label34.Caption := Abcd[9];
    Label35.Caption := Abcd[10];
  1. The above code was put in at the end of the button procedure so that after the information was drawn, the above labels would be set to the new defined array values. Is there a way to set up what the captions are equal before hand, but would actually be updated after you press the button? Like…
program New;

procedure InitForm;
begin
  // form code
end;

procedure SetupForm;
begin
    Label25.Caption := Abcd[0];
    Label26.Caption := Abcd[1];
    Label27.Caption := Abcd[2];
    Label28.Caption := Abcd[3];
    Label29.Caption := Abcd[4];
    Label30.Caption := Abcd[5];
    Label31.Caption := Abcd[6];
    Label32.Caption := Abcd[7];
    Label33.Caption := Abcd[8];
    Label34.Caption := Abcd[9];
    Label35.Caption := Abcd[10];
end;

begin
  InitForm;
  SetupForm;
end.
  1. Is there a way to have the form show up always in the middle of the screen?

Those are the only questions I can think of for the moment. Thanks if you can help! Reply soon.

~Ron

Read full topic
